segments.text: I see the water overflowing from the sink, and it's making a big mess on the floor, which is annoying to see.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes like nothing is wrong, and it's frustrating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe she hasn't noticed the puddle at her feet yet, it's right there!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is really going for it, trying to get as many cookies as he can from the jar, and it looks dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool he's standing on looks so unstable, like it could tip any second, and that makes me worried for him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her share of the cookies, reaching up towards the jar, and it's kind of cute.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman needs to turn around and see what's happening before someone gets hurt or makes an even bigger mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so calm and tidy compared to the chaos inside the kitchen, it's a nice contrast.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long the children have been doing this without getting caught by the woman, they seem to be good at being sneaky.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is a bit stressful, but also kind of amusing in a way, seeing the children being so clever and naughty.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope no one slips on the wet floor or falls off the stool, that would be terrible.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a bit sad to see the woman so unaware of what's going on around her, missing out on the children's antics and the mess they're making.
segments.speaker: PAR
